summary: Email exchange between Nicolas Bourtin and an unnamed AUSA from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a 2008 letter written by an AUSA to the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office objecting to Jeffrey Epstein's work release. The discussion involves clarifying the role of an individual mentioned in the letter and offering to connect Bourtin with the appropriate person in the Southern District of Florida to address the matter.

persons.name: Nicolas Bourtin
persons.context: Email correspondent seeking clarification about a 2008 letter regarding Jeffrey Epstein's work release and requesting contact information for the Southern District of Florida.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose work release in an earlier case was objected to by an AUSA in a 2008 letter to the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office.

events.title: AUSA Letter Objecting to Epstein's Work Release
events.description: A federal prosecutor wrote a letter to the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office objecting to Jeffrey Epstein's work release in an earlier case.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A 2008 letter from an AUSA to the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office objected to Jeffrey Epstein's work release in an earlier case.
The letter referenced an individual who was an official with a company Epstein was ostensibly working for, and who later appears to have been an executor of Epstein's will.
Nicolas Bourtin is seeking to contact the appropriate person in the Southern District of Florida to address or correct information related to the 2008 letter.
The correspondence is external and from a law firm, noting that the email may contain privileged and confidential information.
